<h1 class="firstHeading" id="firstHeading" lang="en">Walldorf</h1>
<div class="mw-body-content" id="bodyContent">
<div id="siteSub">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>
<div id="contentSub"></div>
<div class="mw-jump" id="jump-to-nav">
					Jump to:					<a href="#mw-head">navigation</a>, 					<a href="#p-search">search</a>
</div>
<div class="mw-content-ltr" dir="ltr" id="mw-content-text" lang="en"><script>function mfTempOpenSection(id){var block=document.getElementById("mf-section-"+id);block.className+=" open-block";block.previousSibling.className+=" open-block";}</script><div class="hatnote" role="note">For the municipality in Thuringia, see <a href="/wiki/Walldorf,_Thuringia" title="Walldorf, Thuringia">Walldorf, Thuringia</a>.</div>
<div class="hatnote" role="note">For the community in Hesse, see <a href="/wiki/M%C3%B6rfelden-Walldorf" title="Mörfelden-Walldorf">Mörfelden-Walldorf</a></div>

<th scope="row"><a href="/wiki/Vehicle_registration_plate" title="Vehicle registration plate">Vehicle registration</a></th>
<td>HD</td>
</tr>
<tr class="mergedtoprow">
<th scope="row">Website</th>
<td><a class="external text" href="http://www.walldorf.de/" rel="nofollow">www.walldorf.de</a></td>
</tr>
</table>
<p><b>Walldorf</b> is a <a href="/wiki/Town" title="Town">town</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Rhein-Neckar-Kreis" title="Rhein-Neckar-Kreis">Rhein-Neckar-Kreis</a> district in the <a href="/wiki/States_of_Germany" title="States of Germany">state</a> of <a href="/wiki/Baden-W%C3%BCrttemberg" title="Baden-Württemberg">Baden-Württemberg</a> in Germany.</p>
<p>Walldorf is home to the world's third largest <a href="/wiki/Software" title="Software">software</a> company <a href="/wiki/SAP_SE" title="SAP SE">SAP</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-2"><a href="#cite_note-2">[2]</a></sup> and the birthplace of the entrepreneur <a href="/wiki/John_Jacob_Astor" title="John Jacob Astor">John Jacob Astor</a>, of the <a href="/wiki/Astor_family" title="Astor family">Astor family</a>.</p>
<p>The town is referred to, though not actually named, in <a href="/wiki/John_le_Carr%C3%A9" title="John le Carré">John le Carré</a>'s novel <a href="/wiki/Absolute_Friends" title="Absolute Friends">Absolute Friends</a> (2003), much of which is set in <a href="/wiki/Heidelberg" title="Heidelberg">Heidelberg</a>.</p>
<p></p>
<div class="toc" id="toc">
<div id="toctitle">

<p></p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Geography">Geography</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Walldorf&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" title="Edit section: Geography">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>The neighbouring town to the east is <a href="/wiki/Wiesloch" title="Wiesloch">Wiesloch</a>. Both towns are strongly linked economically. Adjacent municipalities are <a href="/wiki/Sandhausen" title="Sandhausen">Sandhausen</a>, <a href="/wiki/Leimen_(Baden)" title="Leimen (Baden)">Leimen</a>, <a href="/wiki/Nu%C3%9Floch" title="Nußloch">Nußloch</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/St._Leon-Rot" title="St. Leon-Rot">St. Leon-Rot</a> and <a href="/wiki/Reilingen" title="Reilingen">Reilingen</a>. The train station, named <i><a href="/wiki/Wiesloch-Walldorf_station" title="Wiesloch-Walldorf station">Wiesloch-Walldorf</a></i>, is located between the two towns.</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="History">History</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Walldorf&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" title="Edit section: History">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>A group of pre-historic <a href="/wiki/Hallstatt_culture" title="Hallstatt culture">Hallstatt culture</a> <a href="/wiki/Tumulus" title="Tumulus">barrows</a> stands in the Hochholz woods, near the offices of SAP Deutschland.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-3"><a href="#cite_note-3">[3]</a></sup> The earliest documentary mention of the settlement occurs as <i>Waltorf</i> in a 770 deed issued by the <a href="/wiki/Lorsch_Abbey" title="Lorsch Abbey">Abbey of Lorsch</a>. The <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Electorate_of_the_Palatinate" title="Electorate of the Palatinate">Electorate of the Palatinate</a> received Walldorf as an <a href="/wiki/Holy_Roman_Empire" title="Holy Roman Empire">Imperial</a> fief in 1230. The town suffered much during the <a href="/wiki/Thirty_Years%27_War" title="Thirty Years' War">Thirty Years' War</a> of 1618-1648, and in 1689 was completely destroyed in the course of the French invasion during <a href="/wiki/Nine_Years%27_War" title="Nine Years' War">Nine Years' War</a>. The area was settled anew by religious refugees, among them the predecessors of John Jacob Astor, <a href="/wiki/Waldensians" title="Waldensians">Waldensians</a> from <a href="/wiki/Piedmont" title="Piedmont">Piedmont</a>. With the 1803 <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/German_Mediatisation" title="German Mediatisation">German Mediatisation</a> Walldorf fell to <a href="/wiki/Baden" title="Baden">Baden</a>. 1843 saw the building of the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Rheintalbahn" title="Rheintalbahn">Rheintalbahn</a>: this railway decisively promoted economic development. In 1901 <a href="/wiki/Frederick_I,_Grand_Duke_of_Baden" title="Frederick I, Grand Duke of Baden">Grand Duke Frederick I of Baden</a> granted Walldorf <a href="/wiki/Town_privileges" title="Town privileges">town privileges</a>. After World War II, the establishment of <a href="/wiki/Heidelberger_Druckmaschinen" title="Heidelberger Druckmaschinen">Heidelberger Druckmaschinen</a> (founded 1850) and of SAP (founded 1972; moved to Walldorf in 1977) made Walldorf one of the most prosperous towns of Germany.<sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">[<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed"><span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources. (November 2016)">citation needed</span></a></i>]</sup></p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Politics">Politics</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Walldorf&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" title="Edit section: Politics">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div class="thumb tright">
<div class="thumbinner" style="width:202px;"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Walldorf_Rathaus_20070516.jpg"><img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1680" data-file-width="2240" height="150" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2a/Walldorf_Rathaus_20070516.jpg/200px-Walldorf_Rathaus_20070516.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2a/Walldorf_Rathaus_20070516.jpg/300px-Walldorf_Rathaus_20070516.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2a/Walldorf_Rathaus_20070516.jpg/400px-Walldorf_Rathaus_20070516.jpg 2x" width="200"/></a>
<div class="thumbcaption">
<div class="magnify"><a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Walldorf_Rathaus_20070516.jpg" title="Enlarge"></a></div>
Town hall</div>
</div>
</div>
<p>Seats in the municipal assembly (<i>Gemeinderat</i>) as of 2009 elections:<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-4"><a href="#cite_note-4">[4]</a></sup></p>
<ul>
<li>Christian Democratic Union: 7 (33,0%)</li>
<li>Free Democratic Party: 6 (25,1%)</li>
<li>Social Democratic Party of Germany: 5 (23,4%)</li>
<li>Alliance '90/The Greens: 4 (18,5%)</li>
</ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Economy">Economy</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Walldorf&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" title="Edit section: Economy">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div class="thumb tright">
<div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Sap-wdf.jpg"><img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="768" data-file-width="1024" height="165" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0d/Sap-wdf.jpg/220px-Sap-wdf.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0d/Sap-wdf.jpg/330px-Sap-wdf.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0d/Sap-wdf.jpg/440px-Sap-wdf.jpg 2x" width="220"/></a>
<div class="thumbcaption">
<div class="magnify"><a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Sap-wdf.jpg" title="Enlarge"></a></div>
<a href="/wiki/SAP_SE" title="SAP SE">SAP SE</a> head office</div>
</div>
</div>
<p><a href="/wiki/SAP_SE" title="SAP SE">SAP SE</a> has its headquarters in the city.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-5"><a href="#cite_note-5">[5]</a></sup></p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Twin_cities">Twin cities</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Walldorf&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" title="Edit section: Twin cities">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<ul>
<li><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Flag_of_the_United_States.svg"><img alt="Flag of the United States.svg" data-file-height="650" data-file-width="1235" height="11" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/20px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/30px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/40px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png 2x" width="20"/></a> <a href="/wiki/Astoria,_Oregon" title="Astoria, Oregon">Astoria, Oregon</a>, United States, since 1963</li>
<li><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Flag_of_Turkey.svg"><img alt="Flag of Turkey.svg" data-file-height="800" data-file-width="1200" height="13" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Flag_of_Turkey.svg/20px-Flag_of_Turkey.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Flag_of_Turkey.svg/30px-Flag_of_Turkey.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Flag_of_Turkey.svg/40px-Flag_of_Turkey.svg.png 2x" width="20"/></a> <a href="/wiki/K%C4%B1rklareli" title="Kırklareli">Kırklareli</a>, <a href="/wiki/Turkey" title="Turkey">Turkey</a>, since 1970</li>
<li><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Flag_of_France.svg"><img alt="Flag of France.svg" data-file-height="600" data-file-width="900" height="13" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/20px-Flag_of_France.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/30px-Flag_of_France.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/40px-Flag_of_France.svg.png 2x" width="20"/></a> <a href="/wiki/Saint-Max" title="Saint-Max">Saint-Max</a>, France, since 1985</li>
<li><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Flag_of_the_United_States.svg"><img alt="Flag of the United States.svg" data-file-height="650" data-file-width="1235" height="11" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/20px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/30px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/40px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png 2x" width="20"/></a> <a href="/wiki/Waldorf,_Maryland" title="Waldorf, Maryland">Waldorf, Maryland</a>, United States, since 2002</li>
<li><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Flag_of_the_United_States.svg"><img alt="Flag of the United States.svg" data-file-height="650" data-file-width="1235" height="11" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/20px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/30px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/40px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png 2x" width="20"/></a> <a href="/wiki/Freeport,_New_York" title="Freeport, New York">Freeport, New York</a>, United States, since 2003</li>
</ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Sights">Sights</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Walldorf&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6" title="Edit section: Sights">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>The <i>Astorhaus</i> was built in 1854, from a pecuniary legacy of the deceased John Jacob Astor to his hometown. For decades, it served as an <a href="/wiki/Almshouse" title="Almshouse">almshouse</a>, and now hosts the register office and a museum.</p>
<p>The 19th century synagogue was devastated in the 1938 <i><a href="/wiki/Kristallnacht" title="Kristallnacht">Kristallnacht</a></i>, and is now in use as a New Apostolic church.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-6"><a href="#cite_note-6">[6]</a></sup></p>
<p>Walldorf is most famous for its <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/White_asparagus" title="White asparagus">white asparagus</a>, which one may enjoy in the months of April through June.</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Notable_people">Notable people</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Walldorf&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7" title="Edit section: Notable people">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/Joseph_Anton_Sambuga" title="Joseph Anton Sambuga">Joseph Anton Sambuga</a>, theologian, born 1752 in Walldorf, died 1815 at the <a href="/wiki/Nymphenburg_Palace" title="Nymphenburg Palace">Nymphenburg Palace</a> in Munich</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/John_Jacob_Astor" title="John Jacob Astor">John Jacob Astor</a>, at the time of his death the wealthiest man in the United States</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Dietmar_Hopp" title="Dietmar Hopp">Dietmar Hopp</a>, billionaire software entrepreneur<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Forbes_7-0"><a href="#cite_note-Forbes-7">[7]</a></sup></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Timo_Jouko_Herrmann" title="Timo Jouko Herrmann">Timo Jouko Herrmann</a>, composer, musicologist and conductor</li>
</ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Walldorf&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8" title="Edit section: References">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>

</div>

<div id="Towns_and_municipalities_in_Rhein-Neckar_.28district.29" style="font-size:114%">Towns and municipalities in <a href="/wiki/Rhein-Neckar-Kreis" title="Rhein-Neckar-Kreis">Rhein-Neckar (district)</a></div>
</th>
</tr>
<tr style="height:2px">
<td colspan="2"></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td class="navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" colspan="2" style="width:100%;padding:0px;font-size:95%;">
<div style="padding:0em 0.25em">
<ul>
<li><a href="/wiki/Altlu%C3%9Fheim" title="Altlußheim">Altlußheim</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Angelbachtal" title="Angelbachtal">Angelbachtal</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Bammental" title="Bammental">Bammental</a></li>

<li><a href="/wiki/Dielheim" title="Dielheim">Dielheim</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Dossenheim" title="Dossenheim">Dossenheim</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Eberbach_(Baden)" title="Eberbach (Baden)">Eberbach</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Edingen-Neckarhausen" title="Edingen-Neckarhausen">Edingen-Neckarhausen</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Epfenbach" title="Epfenbach">Epfenbach</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Eppelheim" title="Eppelheim">Eppelheim</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Eschelbronn" title="Eschelbronn">Eschelbronn</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Gaiberg" title="Gaiberg">Gaiberg</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Heddesbach" title="Heddesbach">Heddesbach</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Heddesheim" title="Heddesheim">Heddesheim</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Heiligkreuzsteinach" title="Heiligkreuzsteinach">Heiligkreuzsteinach</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Helmstadt-Bargen" title="Helmstadt-Bargen">Helmstadt-Bargen</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Hemsbach" title="Hemsbach">Hemsbach</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Hirschberg_an_der_Bergstra%C3%9Fe" title="Hirschberg an der Bergstraße">Hirschberg</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Hockenheim" title="Hockenheim">Hockenheim</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Ilvesheim" title="Ilvesheim">Ilvesheim</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Ketsch" title="Ketsch">Ketsch</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Ladenburg" title="Ladenburg">Ladenburg</a></li>

<li><a href="/wiki/Lobbach" title="Lobbach">Lobbach</a></li>

<li><a href="/wiki/Reichartshausen" title="Reichartshausen">Reichartshausen</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Reilingen" title="Reilingen">Reilingen</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Sandhausen" title="Sandhausen">Sandhausen</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Sankt_Leon-Rot" title="Sankt Leon-Rot">Sankt Leon-Rot</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Sch%C3%B6nau_(Odenwald)" title="Schönau (Odenwald)">Schönau</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Sch%C3%B6nbrunn_(Baden)" title="Schönbrunn (Baden)">Schönbrunn</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Schriesheim" title="Schriesheim">Schriesheim</a></li>

<li><strong class="selflink">Walldorf</strong></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Weinheim" title="Weinheim">Weinheim</a></li>

Norwegian">Norsk bokmål</a></li><li class="interlanguage-link interwiki-uz"><a class="interlanguage-link-target" href="https://uz.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walldorf_(Baden)" hreflang="uz" lang="uz"
